Html:
Hello community, first and foremost I would like to say thank you very much for this amazing Mapping framework!!

Secondly, I was wondering if someone could help me with the following question.

Let's say I have a polygon A drawn on the map that is the same size as the current viewarea of the map. This polygon has some color fill with an opacity that allows the tiles to be shown underneath it. Now let's say I have another polygon B that isn't the size of the current viewarea but some other size and out of the viewing area.

When I scroll the map polygon A will always be shown. However, as soon as I scroll to the location of polygon B and it comes within the viewing area, I would like to XOR the polygons as to achieve a complex shape.

Is there a particular method you would recommend? I took a look at the Windows.System.Media.GeometryGroup class which can be assigned as data to a Path. But I was wondering if there is a more elegant solution.

Thank you very much,
